meanings.sent1: When he feels sick, he upchucks his food.
meanings.sent2: She upchucks whenever she eats too quickly.
meanings.sent3: The baby upchucks after drinking too much milk.
meanings.sent4: The overflowing trash can upchucks a foul smell.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster made him upchuck his lunch.

meanings.sent1: The dog upchucks on the carpet.
meanings.sent2: I upchuck every time I see someone else vomit.
meanings.sent3: The clown upchucks confetti during the show.
meanings.sent5: The upset stomach upchucks its contents.

meanings.sent1: His upchucks were loud and messy.
meanings.sent2: The sound of upchucks echoed in the bathroom.
meanings.sent3: The upchucks disrupted the quiet library.
meanings.sent4: The upchucks at the party caused a commotion.
meanings.sent5: The smell of upchucks filled the room.
